TopicTitle: How to load mods without restarting KSP

Articles.Content:
Hello everyone! This day I will be teaching some people a really useful trick to load mods without having to restart Kerbal Space Program (LONG)! So let's get straight to the point!

 

  1. First of all, go to either the KSC view or the main menu. KSC is usually preferred if you are playing in a save file.
  2. Then, press Alt+F12 (Not Alt + F4)
  3. Go to "Database"
  4. Press "Reload Database" and wait. It may take a bit, but it's certainly faster than closing KSP, opening it up again, waiting for it to load, getting in your save file, and then doing whatever you wanted to do.
  5. Done! You have officially loaded a mod the quick way!

How to (possibly) reload Module Manager:

  1. Try Alt+F11
  2. Click on "Quick Reload"
  3. Done!

 

Notes:

  1. Warranty void if you end up destroying your KSP in the progress.
  2. It may take multiple times for it to work properly, but at least your computer doesn't have to work as hard in comparison to loading and blah blah blah.
  3.  I might illustrate this later.
Edited December 1, 2017 by Grand Ship Builder

Oh my kraken why hasn't anyone made this sooner...

Thank you!! Take my rep please!!!!
Thanks for the tip, but it doesn't reload Module Manager, which means a lot of mods (maybe most of them) won't load properly.

On 9/28/2017 at 3:23 AM, garwel said:

Thanks for the tip, but it doesn't reload Module Manager, which means a lot of mods (maybe most of them) won't load properly.

Maybe try reloading it multiple times. It worked for me.

 

EDIT: You can reload Module Manager with Alt + 11
